review: Great place, Clean Environment, server was Dylan first time here recommended the Spinach and Artichoke pizza with Chicken! Was simply amazing, 5 Stars for CPK

Wasn't feeling it this last Sunday. From hostess to server... it was like they didn't wanna help us. My mom was craving their pizza n salad, that was why we stopped in after the movie. The roasted veggie salad was still pretty good. The veggie pizza was dry n totally blah. The charred shishito peppers we started with were pretty good. Hated the service. Felt like it was just our group being treated this way. My brother n cousin didn't order anything cuz they didn't like the vibe n didn't wanna stay longer than necessary.

I love CPK. I used to eat there at every location in L.A. they are all the same- consistently good. I haven't eaten this location very often, because sadly, chains aren't very popular in San Luis. There are just too many really good small, non corporate restaurants to visit. That said, I still love to come for the barbeque chopped chicken salad.  It hasn't changed much over the years, the ingredients are the same, but different. So, instead of chopped jicama, for example,  it's now shredded. They also don't have the original chopped salad at all. That was a bit of a drag. Lunch service is o.k., thet only had 2 servers on a Friday, so it took forever to get water, and to pay the bill. All in all, if you are familiar with CPK's menu, and you like full bar, this place won't disappoint.

Visited this location for the first time about a week ago.  The place was pretty empty when we arrived mid afternoon but soon it filled up pretty quickly.  I ordered the Thai pizza and my wife the garlic chicken. Both were absolutely delicious!  Also ordered a side salad. We easily split that between both of us.  Watch out for the complimentary bread and seasoned olive oil. It's so darn good you will find yourself getting full on that alone lol it's fresh baked goodness!  Staff was very friendly! Food was delicious! We will definitely be going back soon!

Not my first visit here and normally it's super great and fresh and tonight it seems everyone is in a hurry to close up so the bread was mediocre and my Multi cultural egg rolls were barely warm with cold sauces  ... Cup of tomatoe Bisque was pretty good although when they served it was like to some random person sitting next to me, I had a glass of Appthic Red Wine which was by far the most pleasant part of the experience! So sorry CPK you were too busy closing up to pay very close attention to the few of us that graced your 8pm

Stopped in while leisurely shopping in SLO. The place was packed.  We had a seat with less than five minutes wait. I ordered the lime and strawberry cooler, husband had a soft drink and Little Miss had a milk.  Baked bread and oil for dip had been offered while we waited for the order (the mushroom pizza for me, pepperoni for husband and fried chicken with broccoli for the little) and we accepted. Unfortunately our food arrived before the bread did but to his credit our food server brought it out anyway. I much enjoyed the variety of mushrooms on my food as well as the blended cheeses.  Our meal in total time took less than an hour which isn't bad at all for the amount of people being serviced. The only down side was we sat by the entrance near the bathroom and it was very drafty.

There aren't too many corporate national chain restaurants in SLO, thankfully.  The immense variety and diversity of really good eating establishments in SLO are a true benefit of living in this town. The fact that a corporate giant such as California Pizza Kitchen has a restaurant in this town is testament that the place is worthy. So we have now enjoyed three dinners here we haven't been disappointed. The sangria samplers are a favorite to get things flowing. Interesting menu offerings tempted our palette on each occasion kung pao spaghetti, shrimp scampi zucchini, and my favorite Jambalaya Fettuccini. I also prefer a thin crust pizza which can be ordered as an alternative to their original hand tossed crust. Dessert of course to end on a sweet note...the winner is the butter cake a la mode. The service has been great! Our special requests have always been granted.  In fact we've been so pleased that we are now members of the CPK frequent diner club. I will add for management that the paper napkin be replaced by cloth. I know the pro's and con's of each but the overall dining experience would be improved. Thanks Foodguy-martin

Always pleased with the service at this CPK. I've been twice this week, lunch and dinner. Dinner was on Black Friday and even with the crush of holiday shoppers, the crew was upbeat and on task. It's not fun working when everyone else is off, and these folks made it a good experience.  My favorite in the Moroccan Chicken Salad. Chunks of tender beets, butternut squash and grilled chicken make this one a treat. We also had the Thai Chicken Salad (with extra peanut sauce gladly delivered), and a BBQ Chicken pizza with Gluten Free crust. CPK has a special GF menu and they also highlight GF suggested items on their main menu.

Gotta say... we were pretty disappointed with this California Pizza Kitchen. Place was pretty dirty, server was aloof.. like he was doing us a favor by serving us, and the food was like ... well... Denny's... really bland. However, the host who sat us was really sweet and attentive.

This was probably my best visit yet with these guys. Tonight my waitress was super attentive, polite, and quick. The food tasted great and is a great alternative to the other nearby places. Tonight I had the Jamaican jerk along with a beehive sangria.

Two stars because they had good customer service. I just paid $20 for this salad. Not happy about it at all. I will not be coming back. There are plenty of places in this area where you can get better food and portions for less than that.

Since I had pizza the night before, I didn't want to order pizza again, which was probably my first mistake.. I wasn't super hungry either so I just went with mac and cheese bites and avocado egg rolls. I'm a huge fan of the avocado egg rolls at BJ's so I wasn't sure why I was expecting it to be like that. They came with two dipping sauces here, ranch and chipotle, but everything about it was just bland. Same goes for the mac and cheese bites... the plate has four bites in a similar chipotle sauce, yet it still tasted dry and bland. The server seemed like being there was the last place she wanted to be....I don't blame her but you're not supposed to show it to your customers.  Only highlight of that meal was the strawberry mango cooler I got. It was sweet from the strawberries but tangy from the ginger soda...super good! Too bad the waitress never refilled mine. Oh well, that's what you get for eating at a chain restaurant when there's tons of delicious hole-in-the-wall places on the same street!

Take out order- my wife and I decided to order takeout (California club & Chipotle chicken pizza) walked up and was received by a rude host, rolled her eyes when I asked to pay before my order was done. Then received my order with no bag, so I asked if I could get one and was met with a sarcastic "it's a big bag," and not even an offer of placing my food inside the bag. Did it myself... To add insult we live about 20 miles north of CPK, got home opened my pizza box to a burnt pizza. Worst experience ever. I have a picture but can't seem to get it on my clipboard lol.

My kids were crazy tired and my husband and I were frustrated waiting in line for other SLO local restaurants. We were hangry and wanted to get in somewhere fast. CPK was a delight to see and Nicole took great care of us. She was so sweet and attentive and we were so grateful that our night had a happy turn around. My husband got to watch football, kids got their ice cream sundaes and I got my mojito :) thanks CPK for always being a great staple!

Haven't had CPK for a long time, was pretty busy but service was very good! Food timed perfectly and the jambalaya was boom!! Wanted to get second one but was too full grabbing everybody food lol. Must try if u in downtown slo! We will be back

Food was just okay but service was bar none. Eric was our server. Not only was he absolutely hilarious but he attended to our needs and special requests. Food gets a 3 star but eric gets a 5 star. This man was simply excellent.
Service was extremely slow! Food was mediocre. We got a glass with cracks down the middle.

Have loved this restaurant since it opened its doors in Beverly Hills decades ago!   The food is consistently beyond good...always with the special CPK touch...They've continued to take pride in the menu, and quality of service and exceptional food.   The original owners had a great concept that continues today, and can see why they've consistently grown!

What makes this CPK so great is the server Jeff. What a kind hearted and amazing guy.  He has such exceptional customer service skills. The wild mushroom pizza is my absolute favorite.  Beer on tap all flavors are great. The Moroccan salad is to die for.  The restaurant is clean and we had no wait.

I have to say as a native Californian, I am surprised it took me this long to finally check out CPK. I guess I thought it was JUST pizza, but surprisingly there is more. I LOVE the sangrias! They have a three sangria sampler flight. All are delicious. They have had a Blood Orange one that is not usually in the slight, but I have added it in on occasion. They are not a typical sangria and they are well made by the bartenders!!  So far everything we have ordered has been very tasty and a winner. The soups are very tasty. The market vegetable soup and smashed pea soup are delicious. I have had the chinese chicken salad, kung pao spaghetti, creamy garlic fettuccini with added mushrooms, wild mushroom pasta dish (forgot name), BBQ chicken pizza and mushroom pizza. I ordered them all the the thin crispy crust. Everything is always on point, hot and tasty. The staff so far have all been friendly and quick. We have gone when it is fairly busy, but have never felt neglected or we waited too long for food. The desserts are also great. The butter cake is good, but I think my favorite is the salted caramel pudding. YUMMO! If you have not tried CPK and think it is JUST pizza...try it! You may be surprised!!

Food was decent. Customer service left lots to be desired. Our server Savannah M was not exactly unfriendly but lacked the personality and knowledge of the menu that one would expect. When you request no onions, it should be told to you at that time that your request could not be accommodated, not after you've received your food. In fact, we've ordered it that way every single time previously so not sure if it changed or she just didn't want to be bothered with it. She basically just went through the motions of service for the remainder of our time there. Not the most cheerful disposition. Maybe bad day? Regardless, that's all we really took away from the visit. I'd go back again sometime, maybe the experience will be different.

Location for this CPK is great for being downtown. And the Marsh street parking structure is right across the street.   Food is pretty good, but they should really change their name to California Pasta and Pizza Kitchen. The Kung Pao Spaghetti is awesome. Lots of other pasta dishes and good variety of Pizza. The new flatbread appetizers are tasty.  The atmosphere is pretty good and kid friendly. Got nice background music going, but it can get loud when it is busy, then the music is really a non factor. Great place to get dinner after or before a movie from the theatre next door. I have been to this location 20+ times, and I think there was only one time where our service was not very good. We will definitely be back.  Cheers!

Food is good but service is spotty to poor. We left yesterday after waiting 15 minutes for someone to approach our table with only a handful of customers in the place. Staff seemed self absorbed and one server was carrying on a lenghty personal conversation with the table behind us. We went to another restaurant and received immediate service.

Surprisingly good.  It's a total city type place, expensive with an over-done ambiance, like every other chain in the price range.  That said, I was impressed at the fufu pizza I ordered!  It was quite good, and I was there during off hours and a shift change but it was smooth as silk.

I loved the food here as well the ambiance! We did not have a reservation and dropped in anyway, but the place was not full at all. It did not take long to get a table and order our food.  The service was a bit slacking. Our waitress really did take her sweet time coming around to get our order, bring in our food, and come by to check on us for more water. She could have been a bit more attentive and faster at doing her job, especially since it wasn't a busy restaurant at all. She was nice, but there was room for improvement.  The food was really good! I loved my order and can't wait to go again! Tip: Download the Pizza Dough app and check in! You get a free side dish of your choice when you do! Just give your waiter the code that pops up when you check in on the app. Saves $$!

Caesar salad with salmon consisted of tiny bits of salmon of not more than an ounce. Ok perhaps to ounces. The croutons were cleverly disguised as more salmon bits. But you can't be fooled when you put them into your mouth. You know they're not salmon. But you paid an extra $4.50 for salmon. I guess that was very clever of them. Service slow, ice cubes milky, tap water. There are so few choices of good food in this town. And this is not one of them.

We had a great time on a busy Christmas Eve!  The food was great,  normal for CPK,  the service on this busy night, was not exactly quick but out server was amazing! Nothing better than a server with personality!  Great job Olivia!!   :)  you made our night!!   MC!!

First time at a CPK and let me tell you, the Jambalaya Fettuchini was outstanding! It was spicy and the seafood was cooked perfectly. However, my review is only 3 stars because the service was terrible. Our server did not check with us after the food was brought out and we needed refills badly. Just sad. Overall, I would come back for the same dish...but in a take out bag.
Bryan was our host on my visit. He was very nice and seated me quickly for lunch. Food was great and service was also.

This place is sooooo good! I've always had amazing food here and the waiters/ waitresses have always been nothing but great. The last time I went, our waitress was a bartender there (short black hair I believe ...can't remember her name :( ) and she was just the best waitress we have ever had! I seriously wish I remembered her name so I could give her a shoutout on here !

The food is always reliable at this chain. We had a gift certificate for a free kid's meal from the summer reading program. It's nice of CPK to do that. Our server was awesome. She even acknowledged the reading reward and talked to my daughter about reading. Her name was Stacy. Great experience!

I really enjoy the desserts here as well as the drinks. Its the only really good place to get mixed drinks like a pina colada downtown. The desserts are really pretty good for a chain as well, I like the key lime pie, red velvet cake and pudding. The food is decent, but I really the Morrocan-spiced salad. Overall a good place for late night dessert and drinks.
The food is pretty much the same at every one of the restaurants in the chain, but the service sucks big time!!!

I haven't been here in so long! Came in yesterday for a late lunch. Our servers name was Stacy, super friendly and outgoing. My boyfriend and I got a spinach artichoke dip appetizer which was incredibly yummy. And for our meal, we got a thin crust Margarita Pizza which is never disappointing in my opinion. It took a little while for things to come out. We even came when it was nearly dead but besides that, everything else was awesome!

Bad service, irritable server Stephen-wanted to punch his nose, joke promotion pizza dough, no receptionist during other visits, food takes too long to get to table. OMG. And bring portobello mushroom ravioli back please.

So satisfied! Came for dinner on Mother's Day with my husband and young kids, and we could not have asked for much more. The place was air conditioned and well lit and clean with easy going music, and even though it was a holiday, we were sat as soon as we walked in. The hostess fetched us waters immediately upon arrival and our waiter Hannah delivered the most attentive and personable service we've ever had at CPK. (or ever had anywhere-- love!) My 4 year olds even hugged her at the end. Refills were prompt, she seemed more than happy to help my vegetarian husband who has a nut, and dairy allergy, and was constantly on the move making sure we were always O.K. I HIGHLY recommend the chipotle pizza and the quinoa salad. (I even splurged when Hannah talked me into the key lime pie and i don't regret it. better key lime pie than my Floridian grandma's.) 5Stars all around California Pizza Kitchen! YOU GO!! HIGHLY recommend especially for families.
Great pizza and great atmosphere. Nice location right down town. The pizzas are big enough for two even though I ate the whole thing.

Good food but unfortunately the service was awful! I was really hungry when we came to CPK for dinner and once or order was taken, we really never saw our waiter again until or food was delivered and no checking in on us after that either. :( It was really bad service! The food was good though. A+ for the food, F for the lousy service!

Just had a great time at CPK! Our waitress Olivia was great and really helpful. We ordered a bunch of things that we hadn't tried before and liked most of them. We didn't like the pizza we ordered and Olivia was really understanding and had no problem taking it back and getting us one we liked!! I'll definitely be going back!
Love the tequilla chicken pasta. So good! Sometimes service can be kinda bad but I still go a lot!

I came into the California Pizza Kitchen in San Luis Obispo, CA about a month ago. On the same day, I had called "George" the General Manager expressing two concerns. The first one being the host telling me the bar was closed when in fact it was not, and there were people sitting there ordering/eating food. The second concern was that I ordered a Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza (minus some ingredients, thus having just a chicken pizza), and the server, Crystal, made an arbitrary change to the order, thinking she would save me $1 off the cost of the type of pizza. As I expressed to George, Crystal's heart might have been in the right place, however she was not thinking clearly that I ordered a specific pizza for a reason, and that if the $1 savings was of significant value to me, I would have found another restaurant down the street and gotten a slice of pizza for ~$3. Again, if I had more time that day, I would have sent the pizza back to the kitchen for remake, but I did not, therefore over half the pizza was wasted. At the conclusion of this telephonic conversation with George, he advised me that he would send me some gift cards to make up for the poor service his staff exhibited to me. These gift cards were never received. On or about November 12, 2016, I had a second telephonic conversation with George stating that I never received the first set of gift cards allegedly sent out on October 29, 2016. While he did recall the circumstances around the matter at hand, he did confirm that the first set of gift cards had not come back to him undeliverable via U.S. Mail, and he further stated he would send out a second set of gift cards via FedEx to ensure I would be getting them. These gift cards were never received. In short, two phone calls later after the incident, I've come to the conclusion that he is telling me what I may want to hear, but the follow up has failed. I find it really hard to believe that he has sent two sets of gift cards and they "have been lost in the mail." I've written a letter to George and the corporate office to documented some potential unethical behavior from the management of this restaurant. It's sad that a patron of over 20 years has to endure, let alone document this poor experience.

I am continually impressed and fulfilled each and every time I visit this California Pizza Kitchen in San Luis Obispo. During today's visit we were served by Lynn. Immediately we were greeted by an authentic smile and warm & kind demeanor from her. She was incredibly informed on the menu, including any and all food & drink specials and had no hesitation answering any questions we may have had. She gave us a comfortable amount of time to decide on our meals, and did not rush our decision-making nor did she disappear once we were ready to order. While the meals were being prepared, I reveled in delight at the creative display my Sangria Flight demonstrated; a careful concoction crafted by the bartender. My husband chose the Moscow Mule and he said it tasted delightful. The restaurant was very clean, as were the bathrooms (which is of great importance to me!) We did not have to wait long for our food, and once it arrived it was exquisite in every way I remembered. I ordered my personal favorite; the Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza. My husband ordered one of the new lunch specials they offer-the BBQ Chicken Pizza & side salad.  All in all the service was excellent, the food was amazing & the atmosphere was clean & inviting. Of course we will be back, next time with friends!

It's my first time eating at California Kitchen, I've always heard such great things and finally choose today to give it a try. I ordered the Bianco flatbread as an appetizer it was delicious! Order a side of marinara on the side it pairs with it well. For my meal I got the BBQ Chicken Pizza, it was also really good. All in all it was a great experience my waitress Hailey was so patient and helpful. I will definitely be coming back.

Chelsea was so awesome!!  Great waitress, so very attentive, even though she was visibly over worked.   It's Easter Sunday and I know they had a bigger crowd than they were expecting.   Took a bit longer than we'd have liked to get our drinks, but hey, they were on it, and took great care of us!! Not to mention; the food was DELICIOUS!!!

It's a chain, yes.  But it's pizza. So...who cares.  They serve veterans free pizza on Veterans Day so here okay in my book.  Look, the service is only ever okay. The food is good but never great. The dough is a but bready and the sauce is never prevalent enough. The toppings are plentiful and good.  It's usually really noisy and crowded at night. And I would only ever come on a weekday for lunch. But it's not bad and if you chain food service, prices and selection this place will do it. It's better than Applebee's at the very least.
We had to ask for our complementary bread after noticing all other customers getting theirs. The server was in such a hurry and it wasn't even busy.

This is a great place to grab dinner while shopping. It's across from the parking garage. Very close to a lot of shops. We came in for a quiet dinner. The service was OK. We ordered one of their new specials which was a chicken garlic lime dish or something like that. We also grabbed a Jamaican thing crust pizza. FYI the spices in the Jamaican pizza have some heat to it so that was a little disappointing for we had a hard time having more than one slice. So if you like some heat you'll definitely love this. I recommend you to order the the roles that they have for an appetizer mainly the Baja style ones are absolutely delicious cannot get enough of those. And a shout out to the bartender that made my blueberry smash drink . Overall it was a good experience great dinner.
Food and cocktails are fine, but the service is spotty and strange. Maybe it's just the holiday season with lack of staff. Or maybe it's just lack of  quality staff :')

Came to SLO today and was craving pizza. I asked if they had gluten free pizza and the waitress quickly let me know they had a few options and handed me a separate menu. I decided to order the gluten free margherita pizza and it was AMAZING!! This was by far the best gluten free pizza I've ever had! This pizza was also made 100% gluten free with no cross contimanation. I'm looking forward to ordering this pizza again when I'm back in town. Also, restaurant was very clean and had a calming ambiance. Our waitress was prompt and kind. I would love to come back to this specific location some time!
I'm NEVER disappointed here at all. Neither are my wife and family. Always a great place to eat. Lunch and dinner. Food and drinks, atmosphere.  Wonderful

I know they are a chain and there are many good choices in SLO however the difference is that they do everything right here.  The food is tasty and FRESH, I only waited maybe 10 minutes for my order and the wait staff is very friendly and accommodating.  This is one of my go to restaurants in the San Luis area.  It is hard to go wrong with just about anything that you order here.

Love their BBQ chicken pizza! Arrived last night to be seated very quickly, sadly the service took a nose dive after that. There were only a handful of customers, so I'm not quite sure why it took so long to get an order in. With that said, this place is still a gem for a "fast food" pizza joint, prices are a tad high, but that can be true for the area that surrounds it. Well worth a stop for a lunch and or dinner.

We had lunch here recently.  Really like that they offer wheat crust as an option.  The pizza was  ok.  Some of the veggies on it were not cooked with the pizza (mushrooms, etc.) so they didn't have the cooked flavor.  Not terrible, but raw vegetables only work for me in a salad or with dip.  Overall, ok.  Also had the cobb salad which was pretty good.
I like your pizza!  The pizza was good.  I had one with pepperoni.   I like your service!!  The people who work there are nice.  I like Pizza Kitchen! love brad

CPK.  Oh man, I can't say enough about this.  First off, it manually preserves intact brain function until further measures are taken to restore spontaneous blood circulation.  Second, is delays tissue death and extends... oh wait, I'm thinking of CPR, not CPK.  OK, well, yeah, CPK (with a K) is a clean, open restaurant with delicious menu items, and this one in SLO is just as nice as the ones I've been to in Los Alamitos and Long Beach.  But, yeah, it won't save your life.

Regardless of the number of people in your group, they're always accommodating. I've come here with large groups of over 15, or as small as 3. The only thing is, sometimes the wait is long for a table. And once, we thought it was worth it to just be seated at the bar, thinking that it would be faster. It's not. There was only one guy working the bar, and with him running back and forth, taking orders, and making drinks, the wait was even longer. I'm letting it slide since it wasn't his fault that he was the only one. I've had their pasta with asparagus and tomatoes, their jambalaya, and various pizzas. They've all been pretty good. Since it is a chain restaurant, the food rarely varies from other CPKs I've been to. I've also had their mojitos and this delicious chocolate hot alcoholic drink. I can't remember the name, but it was perfect for the winter season, and it really warms you up.  I always end up taking some of it home, not that the portions are huge, but it is a bit of food.
Great service!  The salted caramel pudding is out of this world!!!! Thank you Rich and Jen.   E.Zacks from Cambria

Update to our review below: 04/09/2015 We received a call from the manager, Jordan, after posting this review. He handled our concerns seriously and professionally. He was disappointed in the service and assured us that he would address the issues that we experienced. He clearly feels that customer service should be a priority at his restaurant. I definitely felt much better following his call and increased our original star rating from a one star to a three star rating specifically because of my conversation with Jordan.  Initial review: We stopped here on a road trip for dinner.  We have eaten at CPK restaurants before and expected a similar experience.  Oh boy did this restaurant NOT meet our expectations. Once we sat down, our waitress was unfriendly from the start. After our family ordered, I decided to add a salad to our meal. She had just walked away and began to input our order into the system when I went over and asked to add a salad to the order. She looked annoyed and bothered. Once our food was delivered (not by the waitress, but by another staff member), she NEVER checked on us. She stood by the bar and loudly talked about some penicillin reaction (in great detail) she'd had recently with other wait staff while we were eating. This was not really what we wanted to hear during our meal. I'm sure the other customers within earshot felt the same. In fact, there were so many servers standing around talking with each other and not serving customers that we were pretty surprised by the whole atmosphere in the restaurant.  The waitress did show up at the end of our meal to hand us our check. We were paying for part of the meal with a gift card. My husband had the gift card on an app on his phone. Therefore, he had to hand the waitress his phone to scan the gift card. She made a comment to another server (loudly enough for us to hear it) that she didn't like when customers used apps for gift cards because then she had to take their phones. When we were walking out, the host asked us how our visit was. We shared that we felt like the customer service from the waitress was less than satisfactory. Instead of trying to rectify the situation with a manager, he just said that he'd let the waitress know that we weren't happy.

I went in here for the first time today and was really surprised. The atmosphere was nothing I would have expected from a "pizza parlour"  It was warm and comfortable, the seating was extremely cozy, and the facilities were extremely clean. I was reminded more of a wine bar or restaurant. Our server Stacy was pleasant and funny. She had a splendid personality and definitely deserves a raise. The shift manager Jordan also greeted us and extremely welcoming. The food was amazing!! Very inventive and so delicious. I couldn't stop eating. I had the Jambalaya Fettuccini and it was perfectly delectable. We also indulged in some of the signature drinks. Stacy is a wonderful bartender and they tasted like heaven. I definitely recommend this place to anybody.
I am a soup-aholic and no one would think go to a pizza place for soup, but seriously... two soups, one bowl. Try it! The pizza crust is a little too thin for my liking.
Good food. Terrible service. Our server didn't check on us or try to carry a conversation. Seems like a bad day shared with customers. We won't be coming back.

I love CPK! Their BBQ chicken pizza and their Thai Crunch salad are my go-tos! I usually order online and go there to pick it up because it's very convenient. They make the food fast and when I get to the restaurant, I rarely need to wait to get service. The restaurant is clean and pretty big and has a variety of alcoholic beverages.

I met a friend for lunch here. He visits this location often and is well known by the staff. We were there on our lunch hour to go over details of an upcoming event we were putting together. We had papers on the table and were obviously in deep discussions. But the Staff wouldn't leave him alone. The waitress stood there for 10 minutes talking about herself ! Then another person came by and almost did that same thing. This didn't happen just once either. We met again a few weeks later and the same thing happened. My friend had  just been there two days earlier. Aren't "Servers" there to serve you,,, not to tell their life story and make a 45 min lunch turn into a 1 1/2 This is My Life story. Don't plan on having any privacy at this place.

Just ate here for lunch today. I loved it! Just for signing up for emails & such, we got a free appetizer with our meal! So yum. Flatbread with cheese, spinach and mushroom. PLUS we got there right when it opened, so they served our bread fresh from the oven. Some of the doughiest and fluffiest I've ever had. Delicious! I got a Cobb salad- portion was huge! I shared a full with a friend and it was more than enough food. Server was friendly and helpful. Overall our lunch came to about $16!!! And for that amount of food? I'll definitely be back.
Above average CPK- great decor, convenient location with easy access parking.  Jackie our waitress was great.

This place use to be good when they first opened. Not sure if I caught them on a bad day when I did a pick up. I feel the prices are high as well. Lots of seating and close to movie theatre and down town.

I have been here a number of times over the last couple of years, and I do not care for their food. The service has always been first-rate and friendly, however, so I give them two stars. I ordered their pepperoni & sausage pizza, for which they charge $13.00.  It had very little pepperoni, not much more sausage, and was simply not worth it.  Previously I have had their spaghetti with meat sauce, which is undistinguished, and their fried mac & cheese, which is over-spiced.   If you want good pizza in SLO, I highly recommend Woodstock's Pizza, which is just a couple of blocks away from CPK, but serves much better pizza, albeit in a less fancy place.

When we first came in I was worried that the service might take a long time considering the place was pretty packed, however- the manager immediately seated us and our server, Jackie, was extremely polite and was conversing with everyone around us with a really fun attitude. I really appreciated the managers attitude as well. All in all fantastic experience. We will come back and request Jackie for sure. P.S our dinner was delicious!
The food is really good for a chain. We have come here a number of times and overall the service tends to be really slow.

Went in with two kids who are 4 and 2. The staff were SO attentive and quick to help. Gave us drinks and bread right when we sat down because it was a hot day. I was very impressed with the service and they got us in and out before the kids were past their limit of sitting still! Great place to bring kids!
Good food is pretty standard for CPK.  But the service was quick and friendly, which is the reason for my rating.

The restaurant itself is good, but the customer service at this location was terrible. It was pretty empty and nobody came to take our order for nearly 25 minutes. They only noticed us when we got up to leave. So dissapointed!

I've come to this location about 3 times now and the first two were really good.  I always order the same thing - the Tequila Lime Chicken Pasta.  However this time, the pasta was lacking that great lime flavor - that extra kick of citrus that I'm used to.  I couldn't eat the entire dish because I got tired of squeezing limes over every bite.   I also ordered the crispy mac and cheese appetizer.  Not a big fan of that either.  I'm not sure if it's because the concept of frying mac and cheese hasn't really done anything magnificent for mac and cheese itself or if it just wasn't good. The waitress was very friendly & quick.  They also no longer have limeades so I was a little disappointed but it hasn't affected my review.  :) I will go back to this CPK when I'm in SLO but I might try different pastas.

This is probably the 2nd time we ate at a Pizza Kitchen. We went once awhile back but didn't think it was that great then, so we never went back.   A visiting friend asked to eat there, so we went along. I got the tequila lime chicken with creamy jalapeno sauce with spinach fettucini and my husband got a pizza w/ mushroom, pepperoni, and sausage.  We went on a Sunday night and waited 10 minutes before being seated.  Both didn't care too much for the food. The tequila lime chicken pasta did not have much flavor.  Didn't taste the jalapeno and there was very little sauce. My husband said he expected it to be a bit more creamy.  I could taste a faint lime in the cream sauce. It was pretty bland and disappointing. It did help to add a lot of salt... His pizza was pretty bland too. The only think I liked was the texture of the pizza dough part and crust. I wouldn't get the pizza just for the dough texture, though. - the crust was fluffy/chewy and not hard like some other pizza. My friend got the same pasta and didn't like it also.  Service is good, food is ok.

Had a terrrrrrible experience here back in February of 2011. Horrible, non-existent service.  Not once did they refill any of our drinks, even after we asked for refills.  It took forever to get our food, and when we finally received it it wasn't even warm any more.  One of the dishes wasn't even what we had ordered, but at that point we were so hungry we were afraid to draw attention to this mishap.   To top it all off, the food was noooot good.  I was a regular at the CPKs in the Bay Area, and I always had great food.  What a disappointment! We also had to wait eternity just to get the bill because the server vanished and could not be found.  That was even after we asked another server to go find them. Perhaps this was my punishment for eating at a chain rather than a local hang-out? :)

Normally I love going to cpk but this was the absolute worst service I've received at any restaurant. We walked in and noticed it is as busy so were expecting a long wait. We put our names in and they told us it would be 15 minutes. After the first group of two people who put their names in well after us were seated we started to question it but waited. After waiting for 30 minutes and 5 groups of people seated who came in after us, I went up to the front desk. The air head girls one named Gracie, and a shorter Hispanic girl, who were working seemed completely flustered with their easy job. So I asked if there was a reason that many people had been seated before us. She claimed that she had said our name...bullshit! Then after deciding that they would now seat us they walked us over to the worst possible table in the middle of the restaurant. I was so upset that I walked out. CPK what a disappointment.

The wait was absurd, about half an hour. I wanted to rate this place low, but the food was really good. So a two for service, and a four for food quality and taste. If you don't mind the wait and mediocre service, you'll probably like the food.

Husband and I came here on a Saturday night in the dinner rush. Bad idea, I know.  We were seated at a tiny two person table between two large parties- that is always a little awkward.  We ordered the mushroom gourmet option with whole wheat crust. These pies are pretty pricey. It's all in the name I guess. The pizza we ordered was a medium and the pizza we got was tiny. The two of us easily finished it off and felt a little let down. The crust was very thin and the selection we made, while very tasty, was not a good value.  Definitely a family friendly restaurant, lots of little ones. I'll be back to try the fancy multi-colored drinks I saw continuously passing by our table, but I'll probably pass on the pizza.
They try hard and everyone is pleasant-but the service-needs improvement. They seem to be understaffed every time we visit. We want to love this place-right now-we're just friends.

GREAT customer service! I came here for a fundraiser and so we came with like 50 girls and they accommodated us very well! The waiter gave us our own room and was very patient with us. They were very organized in taking orders and getting our food out in a reasonable time. Usually at other restaurants if it's a large party of people, they take FOREVER!!  And a big plus is that I kept asking for unlimited free bread and it just kept coming at me :) definitely made me a happy customer! RECOMMENDATIONS: The Hawaiian Thin Crust Pizza w/ Bacon!

We stopped in for lunch today at CPK - it wasn't terribly busy which was surprising for the time of day (12:30).  The hostess was quite pleasant and friendly - we were seated immediately.  Our waitress PAYDEN took our drink order right after.  When she returned she was ready to take our order - unfortunately, I hadn't made a decision yet.  She returned after a brief moment and I said I needed a bit more time (my husband and I were chatting as we looked over the menus) -- to which PAYDEN replied, "Sure - take your time - I know it's a big decision and all."  Then she laughed.  The food arrived very quickly.  My soup was room temperature.  I asked my husband to taste it because I wasn't certain if they meant to serve this cold or hot but either way they missed the mark.  When we asked if the soup could be reheated, poor over worked Payden looked as if we had asked for her first born.  It wasn't difficult to read her lips when she brought it back to the kitchen staff.   Her behavior was unpleasant, unprofessional and immature.  Our kids worked as servers back when they were in school and made incredible tips.  Perhaps, Payden you can learn something here.  Basic respect goes a long ways.  Treat people in a decent manner and they won't leave you with a $.01 tip (along with a note about how bad your service was).   If you're Payden's supervisor and would like to speak with us - we'd welcome the opportunity.

Servers are usually great but hostesses are always awful. That's what they get for hiring ditzy college girls who gossip and text rather than seating customers in a timely manner. My husband ordered the mac and cheese starter. The nice server said they ran out...ran out on a Saturday night? The food is too pricey for what you get. There are more fine dining establishments around that are worth skipping this CA Pizza Kitchen for!

I've been to CPKs all over California and always enjoyed them so I was pretty excited when one came to SLO.  Sadly, this CPK was just like all the others in every way but one---LOUSY SERVICE.  For the first three years they were in town we went about once a year and were always blown away by the fact that the service at this particular restaurant was so bad, and that it never seemed to improve.  Wasn't anyone from management watching??? Luckily, this year when we went things had changed.  Our waitress was adorable and helpful and quick, the manager stopped at every table to see how things were, and the food was as good as always.  If you're going to a chain restaurant, CPK is the way to go.  Everything tastes fresh and has a nice presentation.  There's a nice variety of food on a large (but not too large, Cheesecake Factory) menu.  I do miss the automatic bread and butter, but you just have to ask and it shows up immediately.

This CPK was amazing just as any other, but I was a little bothered by something... PROS: -clean, good food (i ordered the CPK cobb salad), very attentive service (kudos to Teresa!!) CONS: -they were out of wild mushroom pizza (oh CPK, how you failed me... jk). i've never heard of a CPK actually running out of pizza. I think that's why Teresa was so attentive (i think she's a genuinely nice person, but I think the fact they were out of one of best pizzas out there was why she kept coming back every 15 minutes)
The service was great. The waitress, Olivia, was very nice and helpful. She made sure we were taken care of and made the experience exceptional!

Nice new CPK with the standard menu. Plenty of good food, but you have to ask for bread now, cost cutting thing I guess. Plenty of cute waitresses some of whom will go home with you at the end of your shift. There is one cute little italian guy who my girlfriend is gaga for, and he is a great waiter.

Food is great, prices are a bit high, and the service is hit and miss.  We eat here often though, and the last time we went in I brought a promotional coupon they had given us the last time we were there.  The server (who was exceptionally nice) didn't know what to do with it (it had to be torn open), so he brought it to the manager.  The manager, Tony, told us it was expired.  There was an awkward silence, and then he offered to give us 20% off in lieu of of me bringing in something expired.  Tony seemed to do this begrudgingly though, and when he was done, I watched him take the coupon 15 feet back to the kitchen, hold it up to some employees, and point and laugh at it.  I'm not sure exactly what happened, but I felt like he was making fun of me... in front of me.  All in all, I appreciated him giving us a discount when I was the one bringing in an expired coupon though.

Great location, right next to the local movie house and across the street from a public parking structure. We were seated promptly but waited too long for service and way too long for our entrees. We both had the roasted veggie salad, which is excellent. So you have to weigh the quality of the food against the lackluster service when deciding whether to eat here. Just don't try it if you're in a hurry to get to a movie. I wonder if there's a little ageism going on, as almost the entire staff is under 25. Sure, it's a college town, but I'm confident there are some experienced older servers out there looking for a job. The apathetic servers at this CPK could definitely benefit from being around older servers with a good work ethic.

The caramelized peaches in the Peach salad were warmed up and never saw any butter or sugar.The pizza was not much better than their frozen store pizza. The Margarita pizza was lacking sufficient olive oil, cheese and the basil was practically nonexistent. Two stars for the server.

I was visiting in SLO and wanted a meal before the movie started at the nearby theater.  I was dining by myself and ordered the asparagus and spinach spaghetti with shrimp.  The food was amazing, however the service was lacking.  The server was not friendly at all and niether were the other individuals waiting tables.  I asked for a bread basket and the young man said that there was'nt any bread at the time, when right behind him other servers were bringing bread to the other tables.  When confronted he still never brought the bread.  If the service was as good as the food then this place would be great.  I don't think I will return to this resturant during future visits to SLO.

Went in January 2012 and ordered Mountain Dew and the pizza margherita, I think it was. The pizza was fresh and delicious. Others in the party were satisfied by their choices, too. A great gourmet pizza place.

I very rarely will ever write a review on yelp, but I had such an excellent experience at CPK, I couldn't resist. This experience was completely made by my server, Ali (the pear salad wasn't so bad either :) ) she was incredibly helpful, patient and had such a great personality-- I wish every sever could keep me that entertained!

CPK gets the job done.  There is something for everyone here.  I usually try to stray towards the salads.  My favorite is either the Waldorf Chicken, Cobb, or Grilled Veggie.  It tends to be a little pricey for what you get.  The wait staff is always well trained and courteous.  Good place to go if you want to have conversations--the noise level of the restaurant is low.

I'm still giving this place three stars based on the overall quality of the food, but this place needs an updated review because I have tried their to-go service. While it is a little pricey for takeout, the overall quality of the food didn't diminish too much once I took it home. And it was timely too...the food was prepared in about 20 minutes.  So, if you want to eat restaurant-style pizza, but don't want to wait for a table (it can get crowded at times), try the takeout service at this CPK. It's the same food, only you can take it home and control how much you eat.

NO BREAD?  What?  No Bread?  Okay... So we were here at 7 pm after hitting up the Farmer's Market.  We beat the rush...but they were already out of bread.  ;( I could tell they were trying to rush us out from the very beginning.  As our server took our drink order, she asked if we were ready to order our main meals yet.  I guess so... We ordered 3 pizzas + 2 kids pizzas+ 1 salad.  The usual for CPK. As the crowd started to grow at the front of the restaurant, I could see the hostess pointing to our table.  I was still eating my salad when she asked if we'd like a box to take the pizzas to go.  We told her we weren't ready yet.  But she brought over our check and said, "whenever you're ready..." Alright..I get the picture.  We were in & out of there in 35 minutes.  I eat fast, but not that fast.
The food is always great, can't go wrong with any of the salads or pizzas! The staff is a little disorganized and slow.

They serve bread here? I guess I wasn't paying attention, or looking for it. We didn't get served any.  Yes, it's a chain store. But the food was good -- we shared a thin crust pizza, and each had a salad. We ate at the bar, which is good for people watching, and cook/server watching. Lively atmosphere, and quite comfortable. There are a few negatives: 1. The wine by the glass list was pretty hurting. Not enough choices, and no interesting choices at all;  2. Servers kind of tag-teamed us (which is OK), but also pretty much ignored us and forgot to bring us some of what we ordered or asked for (which is not so OK).  We'd go back, but we'd make sure to order everything we might ever want on the server's first pass. Who knows if they'll be back?
Great service thanks Kelsey prompt, warm and delicious!

In the past ten years, I think San Luis Obispo has been trying to evolve into a little Santa Barbara. It seems this transformation wasn't complete until they put the CPK in downtown where the old Fresh Choice used to be.  I've been to this CPK a few times and I must say, it is an efficient restaurant. On a Saturday night, four of us only waited 15 minutes- the perfect amount of time to go into Barnes and Noble and pick up that new book I wanted. The hostess, bless her heart, as she is constantly being bombarded, is always welcoming.  Our sever was very friendly, and when we asked about the new cream-less asparagus soup, he gave us his honest opinion on it. Then he brought us a free taste of it- love it! The soup was light, needed more seasoning, but the croutons were delicious. A healthy option, for sure. I highly recommend the Thai Crunch Salad- it has a sweet peanut dressing, atop lettuce, onions, wontons, chicken, peanuts, and cilantro. Also, the Thai Linguine is delicious- pasta in a peanut sauce with veggies. And of course, my favorite thing on the menu that is always good- their Tomato Tortilla Soup. SO GOOD.  One note though- I think you have to ask for bread now. I'm totally fine with it, that way, people don't over eat and/or food doesn't get wasted. Another note, our waiter did not write down our order- he did it in his head and made a few mistakes. Writing down an order is perfectly fine and I think is a positive thing- one that shouldn't be avoided.

I am in the restaurant right now and am furious. First thing I thought of, write on yelp...worst service I've ever had here. First, our server was the worst server I've ever had in my existence. She said she would bring bread, never came.  Never asked if we needed anything or checked on our table. Asked for red peppers, got parmesan.  Had to flag her down to get the peppers bc, once again she never checked on us. I also had to flag her down for another beer....she never asked if my friend needed another one. I flagged her down as she was walking by...she looked at me, didn't stop as I asked, "can she have another beer too" ....at this point we were over it. Had to cancel the beer bc it had been 5 minutes and it never came. Thanks California Pizza Kitchen for ruining a great dinner night

I had to spend an entire day in San Luis last week as my car was in the shop so i was forced to do such things as get a facial, have a massage and see a first run movie in a theater. Big day in the city for a small town girl. It was a day of amazing customer service and pampering but the unexpected topper came when i stopped into CPK for a very late lunch.  The nice guy who seated me (tall, curly blond hair, forget name) inquired if i needed anything and i asked of there was a newspaper anyplace. He said there was usually one someone had brought in and trotted off to look.  He turned the place upside down looking but, not today. I went & got myself a New Times and when i walked back in he noticed and said he was glad i found something.  Next up was Lynn and her name tag said she was from Hollywood. We had a spring board right there and compared places we'd grown up. She was a natural and i liked her right away. Time to order and should i have the bacon on the b-b-q chicken pizza? She described the bacon in terms of being flavorful, non-fatty and complimentary to the chicken. O.k., we'll go with Lynn's recommendation and a half ceaser.  Food was as described, tasty and prompt with my salad arriving first and not rushed by the pizza while the kind busser continued to fill my water glass. The kicker: I asked Lynn where a pay phone might be in the complex as i had to call my mechanic at a particular time. She said, "No, you use my phone." and was back in a flash with it, dialed the number for me & left me to make the call. The shop needed to call me back and she told me to keep her phone. Wow. It took a little longer on the mechanic's end and Lynn was leaving her shift and arranged for me to use the house phone for the call. Someone give this woman a raise and let her conduct guest service workshops. Everyone else was so accommodating after Lynn left. They saw i had left my table (thought i was wearing out my welcome) and said i could sit there as long as i wanted until the ride from the shop came.  I only wish i knew more names and i'm sorry i don't. Among the other great people was a fellow named Kevin & a friendly girl with a long blond ponytail. Hate leaving anyone else out but i wanted to cite who i remembered. There wasn't a single person who did not contribute to a wonderful experience that day.

I am not a big fan of California pizza but it wasn't bad. It WAS pricey. I don't think I will every come here again unless invited. There are many other pizza places in SLO that are better. I almost gave this 2 stars.

When I visit my sister in Huntington Beach we have gone to her local CPK on numerous occasions. The food was always good, service fast & friendly and the cocktails great. I was excited when SLO town opened up a CPK. The times my husband and I went there it was great. I always got either the Greek pizza or the Buffalo Chicken wing pizza, but things went downhill fast. We decided to go there a few months ago only to discover they stopped making both the Greek and the Buffalo chicken wing pizza! WTF CPK?! Our waitress explained that CPK was revamping their menu and sadly, it's not for the better. The pizza choices now are boring and blah. The service has gotten really lax , the food always seems to come out cold or luke warm and the drinks are really weak. Whomever does the marketing for CPK needs to be fired because they clearly have no concept between what's good and what's bad. Sadly we won't be going back.

Standard chain restaurant food. I suggest trying any one of the other pizza places we have in SLO because you can have CPK anywhere. I had my birthday here a few years ago and they were nice enough to accommodate about 20 people but they did charge a 25% gratuity--I think that's a bit high compared to other restaurants.

Weird! Like the other reviewers, they never have bread when I'm there either! Maybe they want to make sure we're sufficiently hungry so we order more food?  Unlike this one, the location I go to at home has offered us pita bread as a substitution, but whatever.  Besides that, everything else has been okay for me.
Always has excellent service. Good selection of food (not just pizza). We've been there many times and have never had a bad experience.

Good food and good service. The only knock that I  have is that the price is high for pizza. You are definitely paying for the experience. The spinach dip was delicious and the jerkin chicken pizza was very flavorful.

This is a chain, so  adjust expectations. But as far as chains go this is very good.  Friendly service, super clean, bright / cheerful ambiance and good food. I had the asparagus and spinach spaghetti and really enjoyed it. A decent beer and wine selection, lots of open seating, bar and large plasma in back of restaurant.

3 stars is perfect for this place: it's not spectacular... I'd say it's about as good as any other CPK. The prices are always a little more than I'd like, but the food is great and the drinks are fine. Service can be slow because it can be so busy... basically, I wish the Fresh Choice was still there!

While I enjoy the food, the service is typically very slow. For a chain the food is pretty consistent. The prices are quite high. If you are in down town SLO and are wanting an experience, I say try somewhere else. You can experience Cal Pizza Kitchen in most towns so you won't be missing out on much. I'd probably venture here more if the servers where quicker and it wasn't so pricey. I am fine with paying good money, but not for slow service. Also, the last time I went the ranch tasted spoiled. I notified the waitress and she asked if I wanted a different dressing. Of course I didn't want a different dressing; pizza doesn't taste good dipped in Thousand Island? What I wanted was non-spoiled ranch. Of course I kept these thoughts to myself and remained disappointed. It's not like I expected her to move mountains and whip up some fresh ranch dressing, but maybe at least an apology or acknowledging the bummer would of been nice.

Pizza was good, but service could of been better. I would of given a 3 star rating but for 1 thing...we paid with our credit card and left a cash tip on the table. When I looked at my credit card bill  the resturant put a tip on our card!! I called the resturant and they apologized and said they would take it off so fair warning if u pay with card make sure you check your account...very sneaky of them!

I'm reviewing this particular CPK location because even though I've eaten at the ones in Emeryville, San Luis Obispo (this one), one in one of the L.A. suburbs (not sure whether it was Sherman Oaks, Northridge, or another city of which the name escapes me right now), and the one in King of Prussia, PA, I have good things to say about this location.  I ate here with my family en route to a short stay in Solvang (the little Dutch town near Santa Barbara) in 2006, and I happened to order an iced tea.  Unfortunately it was not to my liking (it was unsweetened iced tea flavored with Torani syrup and I wasn't accustomed to that), the waitress was nice enough to get me a different drink and not charge us for the one that was not to my liking.  I was VERY happy she didn't hesitate to do that.

This used to be a great restaurant, even for a chain. Then, they changed the menu and servers here and it's just become a total crapshoot. I hadn't been there in a long time and decided to meet a friend for lunch. They had just horrible, non-existent service. Not once did they refill any of our drinks, even after we asked for refills.  It took forever to get our food. My friend's pizza was good and I enjoyed my spaghetti. I would have given them 2 stars and another shot but for what I saw on my bank statement when I got home. I paid with our credit card and my friend left a cash tip on the table. When I looked at my credit card bill, someone at the restaurant put a tip on my card! I called my credit card company to dispute the additional tip on my card and called the restaurant. They apologized and said they would take it off. I told them that I had already done that with my credit card company and was also going to inform the SLO Police Department regarding the fraudulent charge to my credit card. This just reinforces why everyone should check their bank statements against the receipt they are given! Needless to say, I will not be returning to this establishment.

We saw a movie downtown and didn't want to go home and eat leftovers, so we decided to eat at CPK.  I always love their salads, and the pasta dishes are enticing.  Tonight I chose the Moroccan Chicken Salad which is so full of yummy stuff - fresh beets, roasted butternut squash, dates, perfectly ripe avocado, cranberries and some toasted almonds on top.  Hubby had the spaghetti - sometimes you just want something simple like that.  Add some sourdough bread and it was a great meal!  They didn't earn all their stars from me because their service isn't top notch - tonight we had to wait to be seated (a longer wait than I felt was necessary), and our server, while friendly and polite, didn't automatically refill our drinks (or ask if we wanted more).  It's the little details that count.  There are so many places to dine- we want good service and good food.  We will come here again - but we tip according to level of service.

So wasn't very busy when we went we sat at the bar a full bar is always a plus.  Our waiter slash bartender was very cool.  I don't think they have many creative drinks on their drink menu I had a mojito mango drink which was nice.  For a appetizer we ordered chips and guacamole which was displayed rather strange.  They were on a plate with some chips and a square of guacamole on the plate.  Don't know how they got it like that it's like when you take cat food out of a can and it lands in the bowl the same shape as the can.  The guacamole tasted ok it had a lot of corn in it, just not my thing to have corn in it.  For my meal I ordered the chicken tequila fettuccine which was good I just expected it to have more flavor boasting a jalapeno cream sauce, cilantro, onions, peppers.  The noodles where cooked to perfection.  My friend had the mediterranean tortilla  spring rolls which she said she really liked and the dipping sauce she said was very good to.  I will be back to try different things and to AI T. I heard from my x butcher that heard from his x dry cleaner that you snort Blastin' Berry Cherry Kool Aid.  Lets stick to reviews instead of gossip.

I agree with the previous poster's comments.  I was in on Tues 1/7 at around 6:30 and was also told that they ran out of rolls!  I mean come on!  They are a pizza place!  Can't they take some pizza dough and make more rolls?  And we weren't told this until after the waitress takes our order. I've been here a few times now and am starting to think that this is just a glorified fast food pizza joint.  For the price, go somewhere else.
Love the place and service is always pretty good! San luis CPK has been pretty good to me.

I SO enjoyed the afternoon at CPK with  !  The folks at CB&TL  supported ampsurf's beachside activities with 20% of the revenue from customers who presented special tickets when paying for their meal!!  How neat!   We also had a nice room adjacent to the entry/waiting area for our fundraiser which was a silent auction.  Needless to say, our display attracted many of CPK's clientele, helping our fundraiser to support our free adaptive surfing clinics at Pismo Beach on most 2nd Saturdays each year.  I also enjoyed a great pear and gorgonzola creamy, delicious pizza with some fried artichoke hearts on the side...my table mates also enjoyed theirs, a 'club pizza', lettuce, tomato, bacon, etc., and another wonderful esoteric and delicious pizza that I can't remember!  Staff very friendly, responsive to requests even when busy - do try out a special pizza from their menu!  I BET you'll love it!  THANK YOU, CPK folks, for your support of our efforts!

CPK is my favorite place to go out to eat in SLO.  I think Lynn Ward is the best server at CPK in SLO.  She took care of us and she earned a big tip.  If you can, ask for a table served by Lynn .... Next best is Teresa.

Stopped here with the family (two small children in high chairs) on the way from Santa Barbara to SF recently. It was a Friday lunchtime and the place was hopping due to grad weekend in SLO.  After waiting a wee while at the reception, we got seated at a booth as requested. Staff were top notch, friendly and efficient.  Pizzas were excellent, fresh and tasty. We all left ready for the next leg of the 101 journey.  No other CPK has come close to this one.  A 5 star experience for what we wanted.

They accommodate very well with large groups! The pizza here is pretty spot-on, and the atmosphere is pretty warming. They bake the pizza in a stone oven for that authentic taste, and their thin crust pizzas are pretty yummy. When I went, my girl got a Carne Asada salad which was gigantic! I'm not sure which dessert we chose but it was very good too! (Do they have a chocolate lava cake of any sort?) This is a great place to go if you want to celebrate a friend's birthday, make sure to call in for reservations though!

Even though California Pizza Kitchen is conveniently located in downtown SLO near the Downtown theater, it is usually not my first choice for a before or after dinner meal.  The mid century modern luxe decor makes all these restaurants noisy, and the service is almost universally slow.   Our salad and pizza arrived after a longish wait, even by SLO standards, where service is notoriously slow.  My Chinese Salad was as described, but where did the idea come from to chop these things into oblivion?  I prefer a nice recognizeable piece of cabbage or Mandarin orange with my salad, rather than a pile of confetti.  The plating on their salads could be rethought. My friend's pizza arrived well browned, but a bit dried out due to the small size.  The waitperson did keep the wine glasses full, and I notice that the new menu features drinks.  Maybe a bit more attention to the food?

The closest you can get to a good gourmet pizza experience. The location, pricing and the menu definitely make this place popular on my list of 'go-tos' when I'm down town and looking for something a little more sophisticated than the usual bar n grill options around the place.  I'm docking a star for the soiled floors though, c'mon people it wasn't even raining when I visited you last!
Great place. KK is the best bartender and Brady was very friendly. I'll be back soon.

I received an email and then a phone call from a manager at CPK and she was very concerned about our experience.  That to me is customer service!  A nice bonus was the "pizza dough" she sent with the follow up letter she sent.   I will definitely go back!

I was here with a group of 30, and was so surprised that the waiter actually made us separate checks. It was the nicest thing ever! He didn't make us pay together and was really nice the entire night.  The food was, as always, fantastic, but it's really just the service that has me amazed and definitely coming back when I'm in SLO again for sure.

I read the menu on the outside window of the San Luis Obispo restaurant and the description of the Vegetarian chili relleno really made my mouth water. It seemed a bit pricey at $11.49, but if it was as good as it sounded, that was OK. Although it was very tasty, it hardly seemed like a meal. A very small portion left me hungry and far from satisfied. It really needs to come with beans and rice on the side, and perhaps some fresh tortillas.

I went here during the day and it was pretty dead which was kind of nice. I got great customer service and was able to just relax and chat with a friend enjoy a really tasty salad. The chicken Thai salad is that so yummy. The ambience of this place is really nice too.

One star because ZERO stars is not an option. This place suffers from the same malady that is rampant around San Luis Obispo businesses ... Crap service. 25 minutes for a salad ... A SALAD! The so-called server, Mark or Marco, was yacking it up for several minutes with the people next to me (I sat at the counter) without even acknowledging my existence.   Do I really have to ask you for a menu? I ordered two items ... that's 2 and he forgot one.  One that's on their "special" menu. Food quality was as I expect from a CPK of which I am a fan but OMG this placed sucked to high Hell! Gonna go back net week and try again if I get the same then this stays on with additions.   $2 tip for a $30 check and I only gave that because I hope that it makes it to the people in the back.  Marco or Mark sure as Hell didn't earn a cent of it.

Just had a party of 10 at CPK and our server Kevin was super nice even though some members of our party were late. Thanks go to him for hanging in through that and bringing us all waters and bread etc. Yes it's a chain but the food and drinks were delicious and we all had a good time. Go!

Normally I would give CPK three stars but last night the service and food were lacking. We ordered two salads and a pizza to split. The pizza arrived after quite a long wait and it was barely warm and the toppings were skimpy on half of it. The server said she had told the kitchen to hold the pizza behind the salads. The salads arrived and I asked for the pizza to be heated more. They took it away and brought it back after awhile and it was still barely warm, the cheese was even set and gummy. I asked twice for parmesan cheese and almost gave up on that arriving but it finally did. It wasn't terribly busy there, I have eaten there when the line was out the door and the food was great. Not sure what the problem was but I heard servers apologizing to other customers about the arrival times on their order. It will take awhile before I return.

For a Wed night, it was pretty busy.  I had the new chicken pesto chicken thin crust pizza.  Pretty tasty.   Love the thin crust.  Almost ate the whole pizza :)   I had a house salad, ate half of it.  Not that impressed with their ranch sauce, not that much flavor.  Had to ask for some extra on the side since it hardly had dressing to start.  I'll give it a three star rating since nothing wow'd me, but didnt really have a bad experience.    Great location!

This is one of my favorite restaurants, and my wife concurs. The name is somewhat misleading, because it doesn't serve just pizza. If a pizza parlor and a bistro had a baby, you might wind up with something like this. The pizza IS very good. Most recently, I ordered a thin-crust chicken/pesto selection that was great. The salads are awesome, as well, and there's a selection of tasty soups, too. The menu also includes sandwiches, pasta and a few other items. The prices are reasonable - generally between $12 and $17 for a plate - and the service is pleasant, though it was a bit slow on our most recent visit.

Blehhhhhh always forced to go back because my friends have no taste buds. Ok pizza, ok soups, ok salads, decent appetizers, good sangria and yummy tiramisu cake. And now that restaurants have all their calories posted for the world to see, you realize how much harm you are doing to your body by eating CPK. Their asparagus soup is probably the safest thing. And ew.

Used to be an ok restaurant, then hadn't been there in a long time and it's just become a total dive bomb. I ordered a pizza and it was just covered and dripping with oil. I felt like I was breaking out everywhere due to so much oil everywhere. It was more do you want pizza with that oil? We asked for the bread because apparently they said it's too expensive for them to give it to you unless you ask. The bread was very hard and I actually hurt my jaw from trying to chew on it. We waited about 10 minutes before someone came to get our drinks and we did not receive any refills the entire time until after we paid the waiter asked if we wanted refills. Overall I will never be going to a CPK ever again. Horrible gross food and WAY over priced. From the last time I went till now everything went up $5+ and it is definitely not worth the extra cost.

Birthday dinner for a friend with about 15 people.  We made a reservation but still needed to wait about 45 minutes to get seated.  I was pretty hungry by the time we got here and so I ordered the Chicken Lettuce Wraps to start and shared a Jamaican Jerk pizza with my friend.  I really enjoyed the lettuce wraps although they only gave three pieces of lettuce which was not going to be enough given the large portion of chicken.  The sauce that was on the side had a kick to it but was tangy and sweet.  The Jamaican Jerk Chicken had such an awesome flavor that I was honestly not expecting from CPK, my friend talked me into us ordering it and I am so glad she did.  It was not as spicy as traditional jerk chicken (my mom is from the West Indies), but the peppers were sweet and the chicken had large flavorful chunks.    Bless our waitresses heart, she was so friendly and brought refills on drinks before we even asked for them and didn't seem overwhelmed by our big group.   I think that CPK is a little too expensive for the portions that you get and I think that there are a lot better restaurants in San Luis.  But it wasn't my birthday so I just went a long with what was already chosen.  Good time but I'll try to avoid chain restaurants.

Just had lunch at California Pizza Kitchen.  We ordered a house salad and a pizzas.  The salad came and there was a little surprise in if.  To my horror! A black pubic hair was in it.  No joke.  The manager can over and apologized.  He offered us another salad.  No thank you!!!  I don't think I will be eating out any time soon, thanks to the chefs at CPK. The star I gave was for the pizza. If you are reading this and happened to work for the health department, please make a visit to this restaurant.u

Really relaxed dine in experience. Served was helpful a d had no problems taking g time to help with wine and menu suggestions.  Food was delicious. The asparagus and arugula salad was light, refreshing and also almost to small. I could have s Kept eating more of it but it was probably better that it was only and appetizer. BBQ chicken pizza was a fairly basic BBQ chicken nothing hugely out of the ordinary on it. The chicken though was very tender and succulent.

I've only been to a CPK once and I was amazed when I stepped in. I didn't imagine it to have a classy-esque ambiance to it. The place is dimly lit and there's modern furniture all around. Quite a nice set up.  Staff is pretty nice. They refill your drinks if you need to and they're bothersome or anything.  The food is pretty interesting. I wanted to try a pizza I've never heard of before and I think I happened to order the Mexican/taco pizza. When I got it my co-worker said it looked like cat food. I laughed and dug into my first slice. It was warm and was very soft. Almost no crunch from the dough at all. I personally like a little bit of starchiness in my pizza, but this was fine. The bits of beans and corn were kind of weird. Not really my cup of tea, but everything else was good. Not great, but good.  The appetizers were pretty delicious though. We had some wraps/rolls with some salsa. It was hot and crunchy. It was also filled with lettuce and meat. Reminded me of an egg roll, but American style.  This place is pretty good but in my opinion it's too much for what you get. Kinda of pricey and there's other pizza places to go to that are better. My meal wasn't that memorable but I didn't leave unhappy.  If you want to bring some friends along for a pizza night but not really feeling the Fatte's or Domino's, this is one place to go.

Came for dinner on a Saturday night. Very friendly service. We were happy that there was no wait to get seated. Most places in SLO have long wait times on Saturday night. Food was good. A friend and I shared a grilled peach spinach salad and a hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza.
